info.name: Scrada Full
info.description:
# Introduction

This Postman collection shows how to use the Scrada API if using the Full Subscription. The full subscription can be used to send a sales invoice to Scrada and checks checks if the sales invoices must be send to Peppol or be mailed. At the same time the sales invoice can also be uploaded to the accounting application.

Not only sales invoices but also purchase invoices, daily receipts (dagontvangstenboek/journal des recettes) , cash books (kasboek/livre de caisse), ... can be used in the full subscription.

More information about the API can be found at [https://www.scrada.be/api-documentation/](https://www.scrada.be/api-documentation/)

On the overview page you can find more information like difference subscriptions and general information like link to the GUI.

# Testing

Send email to [info@scrada.be](https://mailto:info@scrada.be) to request access to the test environment. Data needed in the email: Company name, address, VAT number, email address of the administrator

1. Select the correct environment in Postman. This can be selected in the right top corner of the Postman application. There are 2 environments: Test and Production
    
2. Add a webhook for the several topics in the Scrada GUI: menu>settings>integrations>webhooks
    
    1. You can use the website [https://webhook.site](https://webhook.site) to see the content of the webhooks called by Scrada
        
    2. Copy the 'Your unique URL' on the [https://webhook.site](https://webhook.site) in the URL of the webhook config in the GUI of Scrada
        
3. Create API key using the Scrada GUI: menu>settings>API-keys
    
4. Copy paste the API Key and secret in the Postman variables **X-API-KEY** and **X-PASSWORD**
    
5. Set in the Postman variable **companyID**. This can be found in GUI of Scrada in menu>settings>company>company identifier
    
6. Set the Postman variable **baseUrl**: [https://apitest.scrada.be](https://apitest.scrada.be)
    
7. The folder '2<u>. Upload sales invoices</u>' show some examples to upload a sales invoice to Scrada.
    
    1. If you want this sales invoice to be uploaded to Peppol or emailed then you have to configure the following in the Scrada GUI:
        
        1. Use the _GUI > menu > settings > integrations>Activate/edit Peppol_ to register the company on Peppol. The test environment of Scrada is connected to the test network of Peppol.
            
            1. If the company is registered on Peppol you can send a sales invoice to yourself and then this will be visible as purchase invoice in Scrada
                
        2. Add the journal used in the sales invoice to the sales invoice books. This can be done using _menu>settings>books_. When a new journal is used in the sales invoices then this is automatically created in Scrada in the books section.
            
        3. **Note:** If you added manual the sales invoice book then make sure that the setting '_Invoice Number_' is set to '_External invoice number_' and not to '_Generate invoice number_'. Else Scrada will determ you invoice number and yourself.
            
        4. Edit the sales invoice book. In the property '_Send invoices to customer_' you can configure what has to be done with the received invoices:
            
            1. <u>Do not send to customers</u>: This is the default and nothing is done when a sales invoice is received
                
            2. <u>Send via e-mail</u>: All sales invoices received are emailed to the customer if a sales invoice email address or customer email address available in the sales invoice
                
            3. <u>Send via Peppol or email</u>: Scrada checks if the customer is on Peppol. If yes, the sales invoice is sent over Peppol if not then the sales invoice is mailed to the customer
                
            4. <u>Send via Peppol with a copy by email</u>: sames a in 'Send via Peppol or email' but when send over Peppol a copy of the invoice is also send by email.
                
            5. <u>Send via Peppol</u>: Send the sales invoice over Peppol if the customer is registered on Peppol. If not registered on Peppol then nothing is sent to the customer
                
    2. If the property '_alreadySendToCustomer_' is set to true in the sales invoice JSON, Scrada will not try to put the invoice on Peppol or email it. This is often used by software parties that want to email the invoices themself to customers but only want that we put the invoice on Peppol. For the invoices send by email you set the property to true for the other invoices you don't set the property or give it the value false. You can use the API to check if a company is registered on Peppol or not. This API can be found in the Postman section 'Scrada Peppol Only > 1. Setup > Lookup BE-CBE'
        
    3. In the GUI in _menu>Settings>Integrations_ you can configure to which accounting application the sales invoices must be uploaded.

request.description:
Get all payment methods of a certain daily receipts journal.

This is the same information you can also get if using the GUI: menu>settings>books>edit daily receipts book>tab Paymentmethods

Add daily receipts to daily receipts books for value of 500 EUR sales and payment of this sales is 300 EUR Bancontact and 200 EUR cash.

The identifiers used can be found using the API to get payment methods or VAT categories. Or you can get it also using the GUI: menu>settings>books>edit daily receipts book>tab VAT categories or Paymentmethods>edit VAT category or payment method> the identifier

These identifiers are unique for every daily receipts book

header.value: default-src 'self'; font-src 'self' fonts.gstatic.com; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' fonts.googleapis.com; script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; img-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' data:
accelerometer=(), camera=(), geolocation=(), gyroscope=(), magnetometer=(), microphone=(), payment=(), usb=()

request.description:
Search for the company to see if is is registrered on Peppol and what document types can be send to this company.

For each document type (invoice, credit note, etc.) there is a boolean indicating if it can be send to the requested party over Peppol.

If using the test environment you are connected to the test network of Peppol. If using the production environment then you are connected to the production network of Peppol.

More information about the API at [https://www.scrada.be/api-documentation](https://www.scrada.be/api-documentation/#tag/Peppol/paths/)

request.description:
Add a sales invoice to Scrada. In the portal of Scrada you can configure what happens with the sales invoice:

- Send to pre-accounting or accounting system
    
- Send to customers using Peppol / Email

item.name: Get sales invoice send status to customer

request.description:
Get the status of document sent to Scrada.

More information about the API at [https://www.scrada.be/api-documentation](https://www.scrada.be/api-documentation/#tag/Peppol-outbound/paths/~1v1~1company~1%7BcompanyID%7D~1peppol~1outbound~1document~1%7BdocumentID%7D~1info/get)

item.name: Get sales invoice UBL send to customer

request.description:
Get the UBL document send to the customer.

The UBL is only available after it is succesfully send over Peppol. This is the official invoice document send to the customer.

More information about the API at [https://www.scrada.be/api-documentation](https://www.scrada.be/api-documentation/#tag/Peppol-outbound/paths/~1v1~1company~1%7BcompanyID%7D~1peppol~1outbound~1document~1%7BdocumentID%7D~1info/get)

            </cac:Contact>

    <cac:AccountingCustomerParty>

            <cac:PartyName>

            </cac:PartyName>
            <cac:PostalAddress>

            </cac:PostalAddress>
            <cac:PartyTaxScheme>
                <cbc:CompanyID>BE0793904121</cbc:CompanyID>
                <cac:TaxScheme>
                    <cbc:ID>VAT</cbc:ID>
                </cac:TaxScheme>
            </cac:PartyTaxScheme>
            <cac:PartyLegalEntity>
                <cbc:RegistrationName>Customer 01</cbc:RegistrationName>
                <cbc:CompanyID schemeID="0208">0793904121</cbc:CompanyID>
            </cac:PartyLegalEntity>
            <cac:Contact>
                <cbc:ElectronicMail>info@scrada.be</cbc:ElectronicMail>
            </cac:Contact>
        </cac:Party>
    </cac:AccountingCustomerParty>
    <cac:PaymentMeans>
        <cbc:PaymentMeansCode>55</cbc:PaymentMeansCode>
        <cbc:PaymentID>+++022/0126/70950+++</cbc:PaymentID>
    </cac:PaymentMeans>
    <cac:TaxTotal>
        <cbc:TaxAmount currencyID="EUR">34.71</cbc:TaxAmount>
        <cac:TaxSubtotal>
            <cbc:TaxableAmount currencyID="EUR">165.29</cbc:TaxableAmount>
            <cbc:TaxAmount currencyID="EUR">34.71</cbc:TaxAmount>

        <cac:Price>
            <cbc:PriceAmount currencyID="EUR">165.2900</cbc:PriceAmount>
        </cac:Price>
    </cac:InvoiceLine>
</Invoice>

request.description: The old function to add an invoice (sales/purchase) to Scrada. This function is still supported for backward compatibility.

request.description:
All received documents that are not confirmed can be found using this API call. In the list you can find the ID to use to get the received document itself from our system.

You can get a webhook if a document arrives at Scrada our you can use this function to get all unconfirmed documents.

More information about the API at [https://www.scrada.be/api-documentation](https://www.scrada.be/api-documentation/#tag/Peppol-inbound/paths/~1v1~1company~1%7BcompanyID%7D~1peppol~1inbound~1document~1unconfirmed/get)

    <cac:InvoiceLine>

                    <cbc:ID>VAT</cbc:ID>
                </cac:TaxScheme>
            </cac:ClassifiedTaxCategory>
        </cac:Item>
        <cac:Price>
            <cbc:PriceAmount currencyID="EUR">500</cbc:PriceAmount>
        </cac:Price>
    </cac:InvoiceLine>
</Invoice>

request.description:
Get received document from our system as PDF. Purchase invoices will be returned as a formated PDF, other UBL documents will be returned with their XML information inside the PDF.

More information about the API at [https://www.scrada.be/api-documentation](https://www.scrada.be/api-documentation/#tag/Peppol-inbound/paths/~1v1~1company~1%7BcompanyID%7D~1peppol~1inbound~1document~1%7BdocumentID%7D/get)

response.name: Example

header.value: default-src 'self'; font-src 'self' fonts.gstatic.com; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' fonts.googleapis.com; script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; img-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' data:
accelerometer=(), camera=(), geolocation=(), gyroscope=(), magnetometer=(), microphone=(), payment=(), usb=()

/Producer (Skia/PDF m138)

request.description:
After downloading the document you have to confirm the document in Scrada so that we know that you have downloaded the document. This way the document is also not shown anymore in the unconfirmed documents.

More information about the API at [https://www.scrada.be/api-documentation](https://www.scrada.be/api-documentation/#tag/Peppol-inbound/paths/~1v1~1company~1%7BcompanyID%7D~1peppol~1inbound~1document~1%7BdocumentID%7D~1confirm/put)

header.value: default-src 'self'; font-src 'self' fonts.gstatic.com; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' fonts.googleapis.com; script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; img-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' data:
accelerometer=(), camera=(), geolocation=(), gyroscope=(), magnetometer=(), microphone=(), payment=(), usb=()
